details.title: All set for the Kiwi test
details.content:
Let's go #TeamIndia #NZvIND pic.twitter.com/Wvz1KPKnZM

— BCCI (@BCCI) January 23, 2019

details.title: The iconic McLean Park
details.content:
McLean Park all set to go ahead of gates opening. Under 1000 tickets left so make sure you get in early to avoid missing out. | https://t.co/uPbnwG1jUX #NZvIND #CulturesCombined pic.twitter.com/Ot91j9fxuc

— BLACKCAPS (@BLACKCAPS) January 23, 2019

details.title: Anthem-time
details.content: Players from both teams are out in the middle for their respective national anthems.

details.title: The XI
details.content:
Our Playing XI for the game today #NZvIND pic.twitter.com/Tmy7g31RO3

— BCCI (@BCCI) January 23, 2019

details.title: India's record
details.content: The visitors have won two off six ODI games at Napier.

details.title: Start of play
details.content: New Zealand openers Martin Guptill and Colin Munro open the innings for the hosts. Bhuvi starts proceeding with the ball for India.

details.title: First four
details.content: Martin Guptill opens the account with a boundary as he flicks off his pads to the square leg boundary.

details.title: Shami takes the new ball
details.content: Mohammed Shami starts from the other end as New Zealand are 5/0 in 1 over.

details.title: Close calls
details.content: Martin Guptill survived two lbw shouts off Shami.

details.title: Guptill out
details.content: Martin Guptill is out bowled by Shami for 5.

details.title: Kane Williamson walks in
details.content: NZ skipper Kane Williamson comes in at number three.

New Zealand choose to bat in the first ODI. Santner and Bracewell return for the hosts, while India include their two wrist-spinners. #NZvIND LIVE pic.twitter.com/KXY9cT1X5K

— ICC (@ICC) January 23, 2019

details.title: Score
details.content: New Zealand- 13/1 in 3 overs

details.title: Beauty!
details.content: Kane Williamson drives a half-volley from Shami beautifully through the covers.

details.title: Gone!
details.content: Mohammed Shami strikes again as he bowls Colin Munro out for 8 runs. New Zealand are 18/2.

details.title: Taylor in
details.content: In-form New Zealand batsman Ross Taylor joins Williamson out in the middle.

details.title: It's swingin'
details.content: Bhuvi shows some wrist work as the ball whizzes past Taylor's bat.

details.title: Score
details.content: New Zealand- 19/2 in 5 overs.

details.title: 60 to get
details.content: Ross Taylor needs 60 runs to complete 1000 runs against India. He will be the third Kiwi to achieve the feat after Nathan Astle and Stephen Fleming.

details.title: 100 wickets!
details.content: Mohammed Shami got to his 100th ODI wicket with the first strike off the day. He is the fastest Indian to reach the mark.

details.title: Maiden
details.content: Shami bowls a maiden over as Ross Taylor tries to settle in.

Shami on fire! Bowls Munro for 8. 18/2 now in the 4th. Taylor joins Williamson in the middle.  #NZvIND pic.twitter.com/nmTKJ9pgYT

— BLACKCAPS (@BLACKCAPS) January 23, 2019

details.title: Harsha's praise
details.content:
Brilliant opening burst from Shami. Carrying on from Australia. That seam is a thing of joy.

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) January 23, 2019

details.title: Score
details.content: New Zealand- 28/2 in 8 overs

details.title: Taylor on song
details.content: Ross Taylor takes responsibilty to improve the scoring rate, hits two brilliant fours off Shami and Bhuvi.

details.title: Vijay Shankar into the attack
details.content: Vijay Shankar replaces Shami to bowl the 10th over.

details.title: Score
details.content: New Zealand- 34/2 in 10 overs.

details.title: Spin attack!
details.content: Indian leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal comes into attack. Chahal comes into the game after a brilliant six-wicket haul in the last ODI against Australia.

details.title: Chance, is it?
details.content: Vijay Shankar deflected the ball into the stumps to his bowling to attempt a run-out. Non-Striker Ross Taylor was safely home as the decision was made by the third umpire.

details.title: Score
details.content: New Zealand- 40/2 in 12 overs.

details.title: Trivia
details.content: Ross Taylor has the second most consecutive 50+ scores in ODIs. He is just behind Javed Miandad who has nine fifties.

details.title: 50 up
details.content: New Zealand reach fifty as Williamson strikes Shankar for four.  Score: 52/2

details.title: Chahal gets his man
details.content: Ross Taylor is out caught and bowled by Yuzvendra Chahal to leave New Zealand at 52/3.

details.title: Latham come in
details.content: Tom Latham is the new man in and will look to build a solid partnership with skipper Kane Williamson.

details.title: Clap
details.content:
100 ODI wickets and counting for @MdShami11 #TeamIndia #NZvIND pic.twitter.com/3RVvthg1CH

— BCCI (@BCCI) January 23, 2019

details.title: Dropped
details.content: Kane Williamson is dropped by Kedar Jadhav at fine leg off Vijay Shankar. New Zealand- 61/3 in 16 overs

details.title: Graph
details.content:
Chahal strikes! Traps Taylor caught and bowled for 24*. New Zealand now 52/3 in the 15th over.  #NZvIND pic.twitter.com/IoKWhJrtxU

— BLACKCAPS (@BLACKCAPS) January 23, 2019

details.title: Chinaman in
details.content: Kuldeep Yadav comes into attack partnering Yuzvendra Chahal to test the Kiwis with their wrist work.

details.title: Tom Latham departs
details.content: Another caught & bowled by Yuzvendra Chahal as he gets Tom Latham to reduce New Zealand to 77/4 in 19 overs.

details.title: Nicholls walks in
details.content: Henry Nicholls joins Williamson out in the middle. Playing his 33rd ODI he averages 37 with a best of 124*.

details.title: Score
details.content: New Zealand 81/4 in 20 overs.

details.title: Back-to-back boundaries
details.content: Williamson hits Chahal for two consecutive boundaries as MSD asks Chahal to bowl inside and not give width to be hit.

details.title: Jadhav strikes
details.content: Henry Nicholls is back in the pavilion after Kedar Jadhav gets him caught at short mid-wicket by Kuldeep Yadav. New Zealand struggling at 107/5 in 24 overs.

details.title: 100 up for NZ
details.content:
100 up for New Zealand in the 23rd over at McLean Park. Williamson and Nicholls forming a busy partnership. #NZvIND pic.twitter.com/Cimy0b2hNl

— BLACKCAPS (@BLACKCAPS) January 23, 2019

details.title: Williamson brings up his fifty
details.content: New Zealand skipper Kane Williamson battles on as he gets to his 36th ODI fifty.

details.title: SIX
details.content: Mitchell Santner sends a Kuldeep Yadav delivery over long-on for a maximum.

details.title: Score
details.content: New Zealand:  127/5 in 28 overs

details.title: Williamson's wagon wheel
details.content:
50 for Kane Williamson! Brings up the mark in the 26th over from 64 balls. Mitchell Santner with him now. LIVE scoring | https://t.co/JVfe1bUtf5 #NZvIND pic.twitter.com/oQgNFlgGzF

— BLACKCAPS (@BLACKCAPS) January 23, 2019

details.title: Mitchell Santner departs for 14, Kiwis in trouble again
details.content: Santner got trapped in his pads while trying to flick a Mohammed Shami inswinger at the middle stump line. New Zealand are now at 133/6, with skipper Kane Willliamson steady at one end with a score of 58*. Shami's bowling figures are 6-2-19-3.

Santner has to go. Shami gets him moving across LBW for 14. The wicket brings Bracewell to the middle. LIVE scoring | https://t.co/JVfe1bUtf5 #NZvIND = @PhotosportNZ pic.twitter.com/F2AWpNC6IU

— BLACKCAPS (@BLACKCAPS) January 23, 2019

details.title: Score
details.content: New Zealand: 146/6 in 33 overs.

details.title: Williamson departs
details.content: Kane Williamson is finally out after hodling one end for most part fo the innings. He goes for 64, caught by Vijay Shankar off Kuldeep Yadav.

details.title: NZ eight down
details.content: Kuldeep gets his second wicket in the over. Doug Bracewell chops it onto his stumps.

details.title: Score
details.content: New Zealand- 146/8 in 37 overs

details.title: Nine down
details.content: New Zealand lose their ninth wicket as Lockie Ferguson is stumped off Kuldeep Yadav. Score: NZ- 150/9

details.title: All-out!
details.content: New Zealand are bowled out for 157 as Kuldeep gets his fourth scalp. Trent Boult is the last man to go as he edges one to Rohit Sharma at slips. Kuldeep returned with figures of 10-1-39-4

details.title: Innings in pictures
details.content:
Kuldeep Yadav wraps up the New Zealand innings, bowling them out for 157 in the first ODI in Napier. The spinner finishes with 4/39.

Will it be a straightforward chase for the visitors?#NZvIND LIVE 👇https://t.co/Wslkq5ocbd pic.twitter.com/plmA9d2aQt

— ICC (@ICC) January 23, 2019

details.title: Openers walk out
details.content: Lunch will be taken later as Rohit Sharma and Shikhar Dhawan come in to bat after New Zealand were bowled out for 157 in 38 overs.

details.title: Boult starts proceeding
details.content: New Zealand quick Trent Boult starts proceedings as the hosts look to defend a paltry 157.

details.title: Southee into the attack
details.content: Tim Southee starts the defence from the other end as India are 2/0 in 1 over.

details.title: Words of VVS
details.content:
Outstanding effort from Shami to begin with and then the two wrist spinners Kuldeep and Chahal completely bamboozling the NZ batsmen to bowl them out for 157.

— VVS Laxman (@VVSLaxman281) January 23, 2019

details.title: Can they defend it?
details.content:
Out they go. Looking to defend 157 at McLean Park. LIVE scoring | https://t.co/JVfe1bUtf5 #NZvIND pic.twitter.com/vy8X3EsjAw

— BLACKCAPS (@BLACKCAPS) January 23, 2019

details.title: Score
details.content: India- 12/0 in 5 overs

details.title: Da-one
details.content: Shikhar Dhawan became the second fastest Indian to get to 5,000 ODI runs behind none other than Virat Kohli. Dhawan took 118 innings to Virat's feat in 114 innings.

details.title: Shikhar's feat
details.content:
5000 ODI runs for @SDhawan25.

He is the second fastest Indian to achieve this featpic.twitter.com/LhlKjvtBRc

— BCCI (@BCCI) January 23, 2019

details.title: Shikhar on song
details.content: Shikhar Dhawan gets to 25 off 28 deliveries as India reach 36/0 in 8 overs. His innings include four boundaries.

details.title: Bowling change
details.content: NZ skipper Kane Williamson introduces Lockie Ferguson looking to get the first breakthrough

details.title: Dinner break
details.content: India go into dinner break with a boundary off the last delivery. Score: India- 41/0 in 9 overs. Shikhar Dhawan and Rohit have given India a steady start.

Positive start for Dhawan 29* and Sharma 11* to take India to the break at 41/0. Half hour break now before play returns at McLean Park. LIVE scoring | https://t.co/JVfe1bUtf5 #NZvIND = @PhotosportNZ pic.twitter.com/MYao71u9sW

— BLACKCAPS (@BLACKCAPS) January 23, 2019

details.title: Picture perfect!
Players walk in
details.content: Indian openers and New Zealand's XI walk into the middle along with the umpires as play resumes after dinner break.

details.title: Rohit falls
details.content: New Zealand get a breakthrough off the scond delivery after break as Rohit Sharma is out caught by Martin Guptill off Doug Bracewell.

details.title: Virat Kohli walks in
details.content: Indian skipper Virat Kohli joins Shikhar Dhawan as India look to cash in on a good start.

details.title: Sun stops play
details.content: Umpires have a discussion as the play is stopped due to the sunlight falling directly onto the batsmen's eye.

details.title: Have you ever got sun in your eyes while playing cricket?
details.content: via GIPHY

details.title: Score
details.content: India- 44/1 in 10 overs

details.title: Did they get the directions wrong?
details.content:
That is a first for me. Game called off because the setting sun is in the batsman's eyes! Surely pitches have to be laid north-south!!

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) January 23, 2019

Sun halts play in Napier!

India are 44/1 in 10 overs, and they need 114 more runs to win the first ODI against New Zealand.

Follow #NZvIND live https://t.co/Wslkq5ocbd pic.twitter.com/CW6DpqnuyP

— ICC (@ICC) January 23, 2019

details.title: We are back underway
details.content: Lockie Ferguson has the ball and we are back underway in Napier after sun stopped play.

details.title: One over lost due to sun stopping play
details.content: Amidst all the hoopla surrounding sun stopping play, we have lost one over. India now have to chase the target in 49 overs. No change in the target though.

details.title: Shikhar Dhawan gets a reprieve on 31
details.content: DROPPED! Dhawan is keen on finishing this quickly and he goes for a pull. He doesn't connect cleanly and it balloons up in the air and despite a desperate dive by the wicketkeeper, he can't complete the catch.

details.title: Sun-game
details.content:
Meanwhile in Napier...#NZvIND pic.twitter.com/3p5j18O3hg

— ICC (@ICC) January 23, 2019

details.title: India on the charge
details.content: The target is under 100 and both Kohli and Dhawan are looking to up the ante. The Indian skipper takes Ferguson for back-to-back boundaries off the first two balls of the 15th over. The first one was an extravagant pull which was followed by a delicate cut past third man.

details.title: Dhawan, Kohli keep India on track
details.content: Dhawan is inching closer to his fifty and Kohli is doing what Kohli does, scoring as any runs as he wants.

details.title: Virat Kohli moves into the top ten
details.content: Another day, another milestone for Kohli. He has now gone past Brian Lara into tenth spot in the list of most runs in ODIs.

details.title: India 110/1 after 23 overs
details.content: After crossing 5,000 ODI runs earlier in the innings, Dhawan has now brought up his 26th ODI fifty.

details.title: Dhawan's long wait finally over
details.content: Shikhar Dhawan brought up his first ODI fifty in 10 innings, which is the longest he has gone without a fifty in his career. His previous longest streak was seven.

details.title: Kohli survives thanks to DRS
details.content: A rather innocous ball from Tim Southee looked to have the better of Kohli, who was batting on 37. But the Indian skipper reviewed immediately and there was an inside edge that saved him.

details.title: India cruising towards the target
details.content: The required rate is a little over 1 as Kohli is inching closer to yet another ODI fifty.

details.title: Virat Kohli departs
details.content: OUT! Kohli will not have an ODI average in excess of 60 at the end of this game as he has been caught behind off the bowling of Lockie Ferguson.

details.title: The end is near, thankfully for NZ
details.content: Like a movie whose ending has been spoiled, it is difficult to enjoy a game where one side is clearly going to win and it is just a matter of time. That is just what the feeling must be in Napier and for all the Black Caps supporters watching.

details.title: India take 1-0 lead in ODI series
details.content: And it is all over. Ambati Rayudu hits the winning runs as India beat New Zealand by eight wickets with 85 balls to spare.

details.title: The wait is finally over
details.content: After 10 years, India have won an ODI against New Zealand in New Zealand. This one came courtesy of an excellent bowling display from Kuldeep Yadav and Mohammed Shami before Shikhar Dhawan, Virat Kohli helped the visitors knock off the runs.

details.title: Innings in pictures
details.content:
India lead series 1-0!

Shikhar Dhawan's 75* helps the visitors chase down the target with ease as they beat New Zealand by eight wickets on DLS method in the first ODI in Napier.#NZvIND SCORECARD ⬇️https://t.co/Wslkq5ocbd pic.twitter.com/To2cSukYuq

— ICC (@ICC) January 23, 2019

details.title: Mohammed Shami, Man of the Match
details.content: Injuries changed my outlook. I made a comeback after a long time and spent a good time at our rehab centre which is world class. The management and support staff have been really cooperative, as has been my captain who has always encouraged me. Pitches were similar to Australia but the grounds there were bigger and climate was warmer, here the venues are smaller with pleasant temperatures. Important to adapt and we're enjoying it.
The second ODI will be on January 26 from the Bay Oval at Mount Maunganui. Join us again to see if India can take a 2-0 lead in the series.
